intro: Polygala nilotica, commonly known as the African milkweed, is a flowering plant native to Africa, the Middle East, and parts of Asia. It is a herbaceous perennial that typically grows to a height of 30–60 cm, featuring opposite, lance-shaped leaves. The plant produces clusters of small, pale yellow or greenish flowers with a distinctive hooded structure. It thrives in well-drained soils and is often found in arid or semi-arid environments. Polygala nilotica is also known for its medicinal properties and has been used in traditional medicine for various ailments.
